intro: Leptadenia jazanica, commonly known as Jazan's leaf vine, is a flowering plant native to Saudi Arabia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
